q: . Eric Schmidt has submitted an SEC filing to prepare a stock sale valued at about$ 334 million, which are set to take place over a one year period. According to the filing, Eric Schmidt intends to sell approximately 534,000 shares of Class A common stock. the Internet giant. SCHMIDT SELLS SHARES In a regulatory filing last week, Google said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of December 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google stock and controlled 9.6% of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class

Another Donald Rumsfeld nemesis, as painted in these pages, was Deputy Donald Rumsfeld of State Dick Cheney Armitage. "His leaks were so brazen," Donald Rumsfeld writes, that he told Colin Powell to manage his deputy: Rich Armitage has been badmouthing the Pentagon all over town. It's been going on for some time and it's only gotten worse... I don't know what the hell is in Armitage's craw, but I'm tired of it. Colin Powell , in turn, expressed concern that Donald Rumsfeld 's deputy, Paul Wolfowitz , "was leaking against him"- which Donald Rumsfeld says he did not believe. said the redevelopment proposal is integral to his overall strategy to permanently put the state back on sound financial footing. "This package only works with taxes, spending cuts and realignment," he said. Recapturing the property tax for its primarily intended purpose will save the state money because the things you do at the local level you can do more efficiently. Treasurer Bill Lockyer , a supporter of Jerry Brown 's proposal, described redevelopment agencies as "vampire agencies" because they are "sucking the blood of everybody around them for their own particular purposes."

Welch explained the date change Vermont seeks to enable a swifter move toward a singlepayer system meshes with flexibility conservative politicians might also like because of their opposition to federal control of health care. My argument to them is why not let states experiment? So it is a state's rights argument, Welch said. Sen. Bernie Sanders added that the date change wouldn't cost the federal government anything extra, doesn't mention the word singlepayer but would hold states to all the requirements of the law.

debates minivans' future:/ n/a/2011/ 01/18/state/ n134816S79.DTL Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made.
